subject: Education
title: Social Media as a Learning Platform
description: A 60-second lesson on Social Media as a Learning Platform.

hook.text: A physics professor's TikTok explaining gravity gets 10 million views. Is that education?

buildup.text: YouTube, TikTok, Reddit, and Twitter host vast informal learning communities on every topic.

discovery.text: Informal learning on social media reaches people who would never enroll in a formal course.

twist.text: Algorithms optimize for engagement, not accuracy‚Äîviral misinformation spreads faster than facts.

climax.text: Social media democratizes access to knowledge but strips away quality control and verification.

punchline.text: Anyone can teach on social media. That's both the promise and the problem.

quiz.question: What is the fundamental tension of social media as a learning platform?
options: Algorithms prioritize engagement over accuracy, spreading misinformation
Social media platforms are too expensive for most learners to access
Only professional educators create content on social media
